newsitem.title: USA: ITT delays Planet Hollywood casinos. [CORRECTED 22:05 GMT]
newsitem.headline: ITT delays Planet Hollywood casinos. [CORRECTED 22:05 GMT]

text.p: ITT Corp has delayed plans to build a Planet Hollywood-themed hotel/casino in Las Vegas until at least 1998's first quarter and one in Atlantic City until 2000's first quarter, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

"This is in no way abandonment of the project," ITT spokesman Jim Gallagher, told Reuters. "We very much still believe in the strategy of adding the Planet Hollywood brand and appealing to a second tier of the gaming market."
Planet Hollywood, a chain of celebrity-themed restaurants owned by Planet Hollywood International Inc, and ITT signed a preliminary joint venture agreement in June last year.

The original agreement called for the joint venture to spend about $830 million to build the casino in Las Vegas and $490 million in Atlantic City. The Las Vegas operation was to have been opened in 1998 and Atlantic City in late 1998.

ITT would have funded the development in exchange for 80 percent of the venture, Planet Hollywood said when the two originally signed the deal. The two companies were unable to come to definitive terms over the project, Gallagher said.
(Corrects attribution and drops the phrase "helping lead to the delay".)
"While we are moving toward a definitive agreement, we still don't have one," he said, adding final details of the pact would be disclosed when a definite contract is signed.
